intro: Knoxia brachycarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit knoxia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Knoxia brachycarpa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
